wikipedia_page.main: Lee Edward Fowler (born 26 January 1969) is an English former footballer who played in the Football League for Stoke City, Preston North End and Doncaster Rovers.

response: On Thursday 15 February 2018, Holywell Town F.C announced new signing Lee Fowler on social media and on the club's website. Fowler's move to this Cymru Alliance club created the hashtag '#WelcomeFowls' and his move to the club also created many positive and delighted views on his move to the club from Holywell Town F.C supporters and football fans on social media.

The Holywell Town F.C website posted an article on Lee Fowler's move to the club in the evening of Thursday 15 February 2018. The article was titled  'Lee Fowler puts pen to paper for the Wellmen.' (Wellmen is the club's nickname and is commonly used to describe Holywell Town F.C). The article states that the club is pleased to announce the signing of Lee Fowler and that the ex-Wrexham midfielder is looking forward to his time at the club.

Furthermore, the article says that manager of Holywell Town F.C, John Haseldin, persuaded Fowler to sign for the club for the rest of the 2017–18 Cymru Alliance season. According to the midfielder, he is "good mates" with manager John Haseldin. Lee Fowler states in this article that his fitness has improved since last season.

On 9 August 2019 it was confirmed, that Marcus Law had been appointed interim manager of Bradford (Park Avenue) A.F.C. with Fowler as his interim assistant manager.Marcus Law and Lee Fowler appointed at Bradford (Park Avenue), thetelegraphandargus.co.uk, 9 August 2019 The duo was replaced on 30 September 2019.‘Shouldn’t have sacked him’ – Bradford (Park Avenue) appoint former manager, fanbanter.co.uk, 30 September 2019
